name: Marina Bykova
content: Marina Blanton Marina Blanton Associate Professor Computer Science and Engineering University at Buffalo Email: mblanton at buffalo.edu Office: 333 Davis Hall Mailing Address: Department of Computer Science and Engineering University at Buffalo 338 Davis Hall Buffalo, NY 14260 Education: PhD from Purdue University (2007); MS from Purdue University (2004); MS from Ohio University (2002) My research interests are centrally in information security, privacy, and applied cryptography. Recent projects span across areas such as secure computation and outsourcing, data-oblivious algorihtms, integrity of outsourced computation and storage, private biometric and genomic computation, authentication, and anonymity. Research Publications: by year by type Vita (PDF) The PICCO compiler is available from GitHub. My research projects were featured in International Innovation: Securing Data during Computation. Algorithms and Theory of Computation Handbook Current Program Committees and Conference Organization: PETS 2026 Program Committee Member Dagstuhl Seminar 25312 Organizer IEEE Security and Privacy 2025 General Chair IEEE Security and Privacy 2025 Program Committee Member Teaching CSE 715 Fall 2025
